result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael H Eastman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Fill all prescriptions from a single pharmacy.
Sign all necessary health releases for the agent.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 200 days in jail.
First 30 must be in, balance may be on electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment tool.
Huber granted for work and any counseling.
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael H Eastman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 15CF-445 and 15CF-360.

1:45 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Today is the day set for sentencing. Defendant previously entered pleas. 

Parties concur.

Time ran out for sentencing, neither party requested a PSI.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

State recommends in 15CF-360, an imposed and stayed prison sentence with probation and jail.
State recommends in 15CF-445, an imposed and stayed prison sentence with probation and jail as well.

Atty Kessler addreses the Court prior to sentencing, requests entire jail sentence be served on electronic monitor.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-360:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 42 Months
Conditions:
Do not possess any firearms 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Jail sentence of 120 Days
2 Days credit to be applied against the 120 days
First 30 days in jail, balance may be on Electronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment tool
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
No contact with Cody Recore, Vicki Recore and Kristina Kekos
Submit DNA Sample
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge


15CF-445:
Count 1:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 4 Years
Conditions:
Serve 200 days in jail
First 30 must be in, balance may be on lectronic Monitoring if approved by jail administration and risk assessment tool
Huber granted for work and any counseling
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Concurrent to 15CF-360
AODA Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Fill all prescriptions from a single pharmacy
Sign all necessary health releases for the agent
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Pay Costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay $300 cost (buy money to Portage County Sheriff's Dept)


Bonds paid are to be applied to costs/fines/surcharges
20 days in which to appeal the case
Sentencing hearing on June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael H Eastman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CF360, 15CF445

10:10 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF360 Count 1 - NO CONTEST 
15CF445 Count 1 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Defendant acknowledges prior felony conviction.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF360 Count 1, 15CF445 Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read-in: 15CF350 Count 2, 15CF445 Count 2.

Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael H.G. Eastman in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:20 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Atty Molepske provides the Information.

BY THE COURT:
Bond conditions of Bond continued
